New Relic Roadmap: A Complete Guide [2025 Updated]

Master New Relic in 2025 with this roadmap covering platform setup, APM, AI monitoring, logs, dashboards, alerting, and best practices.

What is New Relic?

New Relic is an enterprise-grade observability platform that provides holistic insights into applications, infrastructure, logs, events, and now AI workloads.

Why New Relic?

It unifies telemetry—metrics, logs, traces—across the stack, supports automated AI content inspection and alerting, and integrates with CI/CD and collaboration tools.

1. Installation & Setup

Install agents for APM (Java, Node.js, Python, .NET), infrastructure, browser, and mobile. Configure API keys and license.

2. APM & Infrastructure Monitoring

Monitor transactions, service maps, traces, database queries, and integrate with Kubernetes or serverless environments.

3. New Relic Logs & Events

Centralize logs, add custom attributes, query via NRQL, visualize alongside metrics and traces.

4. Dashboards & Visualizations

Use dashboards built with charts, tables, and widgets; embed logs/traces; enable dynamic filters.

5. Alerting & Incident Response

Create NRQL-based alerts, define thresholds and incident workflows, integrate with Slack/PagerDuty.

6. AI Monitoring

Leverage industry’s first APM for AI—trace LLM performance, token usage, errors, latency, bias, cost across AI models and prompts.

7. Agentic AI Integrations

Automate observability-enhanced workflows using ServiceNow and Gemini integrations to avoid context switching.

8. Predictive Analytics

Forecast metrics (with ML) and use causal AI to explain anomalies; integrate predictions as alert conditions.

9. Transaction 360

Use this feature for end-to-end service correlation and faster root-cause analysis across distributed systems.

10. Database Performance Monitoring

Monitor query-level performance and execution plans for MySQL, PostgreSQL and SQL Server to uncover bottlenecks.

11. Queues & Streams

Monitor Kafka, SQS, RabbitMQ with full producer/consumer visibility and topic-level insights.

12. CI/CD & CodeStream

Integrate with pipelines and use CodeStream to view code-level metrics alongside production telemetry.

13. Security & Vulnerability Management

Monitor open-source dependencies, detect vulnerabilities, and enforce compliance policies.

14. Observability Extensibility

Capture custom data via Event API, create dashboards and query via NRQL.

15. Platform Automation

Automate dashboards & alerts via YAML/JSON provisioning or CLI scripts.

16. Performance & Scalability

Use data streaming, cache strategies, and intelligent sampling to manage volume and control costs.

17. High Availability & Multi‑Region

Use HA setups, edge data routing, and redundant collectors.

18. Team & Access Management

Define role-based access, SSO, team-level dashboard control, and audit logging.

19. Monitoring Ecosystem & Integrations

Integrates with AWS, GCP, Azure, Kubernetes, GitHub Copilot, Gemini, and more.

20. Best Practices

Deploy agents broadly, leverage AI tools (Predictions, Monitoring), optimize alert thresholds, and run regular telemetry reviews.
